{{Infobox military person |honorific_prefix=[[Captain (Royal Navy)|Captain]] |name = Cecil Ryther Acklom |honorific_suffix=[[Order of the Bath|CB]] [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]] | image = | caption = | birth_date =31 May 1872 | death_date =12 June 1937 | placeofburial_label = | placeofburial = [[London]], England, UK | birth_place = [[Băuțar]], Romania | death_place = [[Clontarf, Dublin|Clontarf]], [[Dublin]], Ireland | placeofburial_coordinates = <!-- {{coord|LAT|LONG|display=inline,title}} --> | nickname = | allegiance = {{flag|United Kingdom}} | branch = {{navy|United Kingdom}} | serviceyears = 1885–1919 | rank = [[Captain (Royal Navy)|Captain]] | unit = | commands = | battles = [[Witu, Kenya|Vitu, First Expedition 1890]] | awards = [[Order of the Bath|CB]] [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]] | relations = [[George Moreby Acklom]], [[David Manners]] | laterwork = }} [[Captain (Royal Navy)|Captain]] '''Cecil Ryther Acklom''' [[Order of the Bath|CB]] [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]] (31 May 1872 – 12 June 1937), was a senior British officer in the [[Royal Navy]], ‘a key figure in the development of the [[torpedo]] for over a decade’,<ref name="google.co.uk">{{cite web|url=https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=3fisAAAAQBAJ&pg=PA59&dq=cecil+ryther+acklom+torpedo&hl=en&sa=X&ei=FSj8VL32C6T5ywOr44HQDQ&ved=0CCAQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=cecil%20ryther%20acklom%20torpedo&f=false|title=Torpedo|work=google.co.uk|accessdate=8 March 2015}}</ref> Assistant Superintendent at the [[Royal Arsenal|Royal Gun Factory, Woolwich]] (1899-1910) and Superintendent of the Royal [[Torpedo]] Factory in [[Greenock]] (1910-19).<ref name="auto">Who Was Who, Published by A&C Black Limited</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://collections.rmg.co.uk/archive/objects/462823.html|title=Uncatalogued: Acklom, Cecil Ryther, Captain, 1872-1937 - National Maritime Museum|work=rmg.co.uk}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.mocavo.com/Whitaker-S-Peerage-Baronetage-Knightage-and-Companionage-1916/387382/151|title=Whitaker's peerage, baronetage, knightage, and companionage (1916)|work=Mocavo}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://oxfordindex.oup.com/view/10.1093/ww/9780199540884.013.U205060|title=ACKLOM, Cecil Ryther (1872 - 1937)|work=oup.com}}</ref>
==Life and career== Acklom was born on 31 May 1872, the son of Robert Evatt Acklom.<ref name="auto"/><ref>British BMD Records</ref>
Acklom entered the [[Royal Navy]] in 1885 and in 1890 saw action in [[East Africa]] on the coast at [[Witu, Kenya|Vitu]] where he was awarded a medal and clasp.<ref name="auto"/> Between 1901 and 1910 he played a key role in the development of the [[torpedo]] for the [[Royal Navy]]<ref name="google.co.uk"/> and later became Assistant Superintendent at the [[Royal Arsenal|Royal Gun Factory, Woolwich]] between 1899 and 1910 before becoming Superintendent of the Royal Navy Torpedo Factory, [[Greenock]] between 1910 and 1919.<ref name="auto"/> He was made [[Order of the Bath|CB]] in 1914<ref>https://www.thegazette.co.uk/London/issue/28842/supplement/4876/data.pdf</ref><ref name="auto"/> and [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]] in 1919.<ref>https://www.thegazette.co.uk/London/issue/31398/supplement/7508/data.pdf</ref>
Acklom never married.<ref name="auto"/> He was the brother of [[George Moreby Acklom]] and the uncle of [[David Manners]].<ref>British BMD Indexes</ref> He died on 12 June 1937.<ref name="auto"/>
